name: sshtun
short_description:
A Linux application.
REQUIRES python3.2+
REQUIRES git

How to get it working, as easy as 1, 2, 3 !:
1) git clone ssh://zeroblue@git.code.sf.net/p/sshtun/code sshtun-code
2) cd sshtun-code
3) sudo python3 setup.py

then run the program:
python3 SSHTunnel.py

If something goes wrong you will likely have to install the dependencies yourself: 
Namely, PySide for python3 http://qt-project.org/wiki/PySide_Binaries_Linux

You should also have openssh and firefox(optional) installed.




Dynamically tunnels any application through ssh allowing you to remain anonymous and protect your information online.

Tested on Ubuntu 12.04+

Should work on all recent versions of:
Ubuntu and most other Debian derivatives
Debian
openSUSE
ArchLinux
Fedora and derivatives
summary: The poor man's VPN: Tunnel your applications to remain anonymous
